premises: If the inflation rate increases, then the cost of living increases
incorrect conclusions: The cost of living does not increase
The cost of living increases implies that the inflation rate increases
The cost of living does not increase implies that the inflation rate increases
If the inflation rate does not increase, then the cost of living does not increase

premises: If unemployment rises, then consumer spending decreases
incorrect conclusions: Consumer spending decreases implies that unemployment rises
Consumer spending does not decrease implies that unemployment rises
If unemployment does not rise, then consumer spending does not decrease

premises: If government spending increases, then the national debt increases
incorrect conclusions: The national debt does not increase
The national debt increases implies that government spending increases
The national debt does not increase implies that government spending increases
If government spending does not increase, then the national debt does not increase
